data.event: It had a stage station in the early days of the Oregon Trail, a post office in 1866 and a water powered gist mill in 1871.
The Ward Massacre occurred near the site in 1854.
The Boise River flooded in 1872 and cut a new channel, isolating the town on an island; as a result, the town moved to a new location in the years after 1880.

event.title: moved to a new location in the years

data.event: The Boise River flooded in 1872 and cut a new channel, isolating the town on an island; as a result, the town moved to a new location in the years after 1880.
The town incorporated as a city in 1910, although the certificate was not issued until 1971.
The town incorporated as a city in 1910, although the certificate was not issued until 1971.

event.title: February 1, 2007, 78% of Middleton High School burned down

data.event: On February 1, 2007, 78% of Middleton High School burned down, caused by the overheating of a fan above the weight room.

event.title: the construction of the school in the 1960s

data.event: To save money during the construction of the school in the 1960s, the sprinklers were installed but were never connected to a water source.
